serinfo.issue: 2008 World, Europe, United States, Canada, and Mexico

descript.abstract:
World Map Background is a polygon theme representing grid cells of 30 by 30 degrees that cover the world.
This dataset is a part of the 2008 ESRI Data and Maps Collection.
descript.purpose: World Map Background provides for displaying a shaded background on which other data can be displayed. For example, use the World Map Background to quickly display a blue ocean theme behind other land-based themes such as World Countries.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States: Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local ESRI Regional Office. For support, you may contact ESRI Support Center by telephone (voice) between 6:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing 888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at 909-792-0960; electronic mail (e-mail) support@esri.com; or visit http://support.esri.com/; ESRI holidays excluded.
Outside the United States Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local ESRI International Distributor. This information can be found at http://gis.esri.com/intldist/contact/.
For other questions or comments, you may contact ESRI headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.1.0.722

dataqual.logic: The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using either ESRI SDC Data Development Kit Professional 2 (DDKP2) or tools in ArcGIS. The SDC data set is then loaded into ArcSDE to verify and validate the geometry.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.

horizpa.horizpar: The geospatial part of this data set was mathematically generated using the ARC/INFO GRID extension. In this manner, the locations were computed. The positional accuracy is limited only by the resolution of the data set, which is less than a meter.

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by ESRI: Generated the geospatial part of this data set mathematically using the ARC/INFO GRID extension. Added unique values attribute.

The following steps were performed by ESRI: Extracted data set from ESRI Data & Maps Volume 1. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr). Created projection file (.prj). Created spatial indices. Converted the data set to SDC.

The following steps were performed by ESRI: Corrected the north and east geographic extents. Renamed WRLD30_ID to WRLD_ID and reduced its width. Converted the data set to SDC. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.

geodetic.horizdn: This data set was mathematically generated. You can define or use it unchanged with data based on any datum.

enttyp.enttypd: The polygons represent grid cells of 30 by 30 degrees for the world.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The unique identifier of the grid cell.

Outside the United States, please direct all inquiries to your local ESRI International Distributor. This information can be found at http://gis.esri.com/intldist/contact/.

stdorder.ordering: ESRI Data & Maps is available only as part of ESRI software.

distinfo.techpreq: To use this data requires software that supports SDC files.

cntorgp.cntorg: Research Data Services (RDS), Columbia University Libraries
